Yarnee FTUE

Home/Portfolio/Yarnee

Released :February 2014

Role :Design

Client :Yarnee

Tools:Sketch, XCode, Pixate

Yarnee

In 2014, i began working with Yarnee during development on their new social curation app. My first task was to design the First Time User Experience for the app, introducing the primary features of the app.

Further to this, i worked on UX improvements and delivered design proposals for the marketing product page and a web implementation of the Yarnee view.

Discovery

Yarnee is a mobile app that lets you create shareable collections of your favourite content.

I began working with the team during development of the app and enjoyed the opportunity to engage in the early design decisions, suggesting work flows and having the freedom to explore ideas to communicate the key app functionality through a First Time User Experience.

The Challenge - Present the core functionality of the Yarnee app in an engaging and informative approach.

The Solution - Design a First Time User Experience (FTUE) which introduces the Yarnee app. Understanding the key elements that the app offers and introducing these in a connected fashion.

Inspiration

Circular elements were a distinctive feature of the app itself and so i wanted to maintain that across the FTUE. The principle action of bringing together multiple sources of information gave rise to the notion of overlapping circles, mind maps, and information sharing.

Experience

In consultations with the client, the introduction to the IFTTT app was highlighted as an example case. Using static elements anchored at points along an infinite Y plane, scrolling left/right created an animation effect of element planes moving across each other, representing an evolving storyboard.

Sketching

After discussions with the Yarnee team, and using the in-development app myself, i was able to identify core functionality and began to focus the design on the key process flow of the Collection, Selection and Curation of content into a 'Yarn'.

I proposed a design which presented a singular 'Yarn' centre screen, with floating elements being collected as the FTUE progressed via scroll along a timeline. Gaining more knowledge of the animation libraries, I was able to expand on the initial design to include X & Z axis movement together with rotational elements to provide greater movement through the FTUE.

Code

Working closely with the developer, together we investigated animation libraries and the options available to implement the design within the app. The 'Jazzhands' animation library was used, which allowed us to clear a lot of the implementation hurdles easily.

A key aspect of the design was investigating timing considerations for individual elements. I had access to the XCode project and so was able to directly code changes myself and, utilizing the simulator, to quickly generate a range of parameterisations to discuss with the client.

Results

The FTUE was implemented in the initial release of the Yarnee app.

Yarnee.

Quick and Easy Collections of Your Favourite Content.

Yarnee

The social curation app for iPhone. For moments that belong together.
